channel.title: Caderno
channel.description:
It's notepad, but really shiney, with syntax highlighting for a few languages, php dev tools, session management, search-as-you-type feature and most importantly, made by meh! :D [url=http://freddy1990.com/index.php?page=product&name=caderno][img]http://freddy1990.com/images/featured/caderno.png[/img][/url]
[img]http://freddy1990.com/images/screenshots/caderno.png[/img] [img]http://freddy1990.com/images/screenshots/caderno2.png[/img]

item.title: Caderno
item.dc:creator: @Koolvin Koolvin
item.description:

scite is better sry
[/quote]

e is better sry

They’ve been under development for years, Caderno only 8 months… I can only do so much at once, lol[/quote]Proof?

Read full topic

item.title: Caderno
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:64, topic:314996”][quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=411442.msg3172905#msg3172905 date=1270579127]

I like ribbons. Keep it.

Caderno 3 won’t have ribbons, it’s decided.

Will Canderno 3 fit on a 1.44mb floppy disc?
[/quote]
Unlikely, no one uses floppy disks anyway, lol…
But it’ll start way faster[/quote]…

[/quote]
My host fracked up again, they’re fixing the problem, I’m moving to a new host soon though and I’m gonna rework part of Cadero. Btw, any opinions on whether i should or shouldn’t implement an Office 2007 look?[/quote]
Personally I hate the look of Office 2007. If it didn’t many more features than 2003, then I wouldn’t use it.

item.title: Caderno
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:47, topic:314996”][quote author=Freddy1990 link=topic=411442.msg3051144#msg3051144 date=1260098835]

I like it… But its not portable because it doesn’t fit on a floppy disc[3.5" 1.44mb]!!! I still like it.

Lol, writing portable settings to a floppy, must hurt closing time =P

why would you write settings on closing time instead of when they are set?

Because doing so from and to a slow portable medium would cause lag…
[/quote]

And if the program or computer crashes, or if they unplug the flash drive, then you lose all your settings?[/quote]
Myeah, they’re all valid points, I’ll consider it…

Read full topic

item.title: Caderno
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Unhandled:

Not if you’re smart about it…Just hide the editor window and spin off a thread to write the settings, exiting when the thread is done. The user won’t know the difference.

Hmm, not talking about lagging the application, I mean the drive itself…

Read full topic
